hypothesis_content.title: Momentum Divergence in Large-Cap vs. Small-Cap During News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL/BEAR regimes, when positive crypto news triggers a sharp intraday spike (>5% in 2 hours) in large-caps (BTC/ETH), but small-cap index (coins ranked 51-200) shows relative weakness (returns < 50% of BTC's), shorting small-caps relative to large-caps over next 24 hours yields alpha as liquidity flows back out after failed momentum transfer.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In weak regimes, news-driven rallies are often shallow and liquidity-constrained. If momentum fails to propagate to riskier small-caps, it indicates weak breadth and likely reversal. This divergence captures the retracement as speculative capital exits.
entry_conditions: Crypto news sentiment score > 0.7 (positive) on major aggregators
Small-cap index (51-200) 2-hour return < 50% of BTC's return
Enter small-cap short / large-cap long pair at next hourly close

exit_conditions.take_profit: Small-cap index underperformance reaches 2x the initial divergence
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Small-cap index outperforms BTC/ETH over any 4-hour period

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Pair returns not statistically significant (p > 0.1) across 30+ historical news events, or more than 40% of trades hit stop-loss before take-profit.
